metadata.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory explores the relationship between sustainable energy practices and the theory of dependency.

entities.Description: Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory addresses energy inequality by promoting equitable access to sustainable energy resources.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory employs renewable energy technologies to reduce dependence on fossil fuels and promote environmental sustainability.

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory collaborates with academic institutions to conduct research and develop innovative solutions for sustainable energy development.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory supports community-based renewable energy projects to empower local communities and promote sustainable development.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory administers energy efficiency programs to promote energy conservation and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory measures energy access index to assess the progress and impact of sustainable energy initiatives.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals to promote sustainable energy as a key driver of social and economic progress.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Sustainable energy and dependency theory is an instance of energy transition theory that focuses on the role of energy in shaping socio-economic systems.
relations.Subject: sustainable energy and dependency theory

relations.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.
